p:
Descriptive statistics were estimated for each collection site with ≥17 samples, as well as for the groups inferred from the population structure analyses. Arlequin v. 3.5.1.3
75 was used to test for genotypic linkage disequilibrium among loci within sites (20,000 iterations; P < 0.05), and for departures from Hardy–Weinberg equilibrium using the score test for heterozygote deficiency with level of significance determined by the Markov chain method (1,000,000 iterations). Arlequin v. 3.5.1.3
75 was also used to estimate the number of alleles (N A), observed (H O) and expected (H E) heterozygosity and inbreeding coefficient (F IS). Allelic richness (A R) was rarefied to 17 samples using FSTAT
76 . The number of private alleles (N PA) was calculated using Convert v. 1.31
77 .
